result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs and all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12-31-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Arteveo Roquemore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  address correction.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre Arteveo Roquemore
Current: 2662 N 51st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-06-2015)
Prior: 2533 North 49th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. On motion of the State, Court orders penalty enhancer dismissed. 

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms (body armor); also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Statements made as to sentencing.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with 218 days credit for time served. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs due by 12/31/15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12/31/15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
/motion in limine/proposed jury instructions, filed by the State.

Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.   Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.9.15 and for jury trial on 10.5.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case will remained calendared.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties stipulate to Attorney Jeff Wilson substituting Attorney John Forrestal as attorney of record.  Status conference scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John J. Forrestal in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John J. Forrestal in court, defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 04-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).

Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Andre Arteveo Roquemore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
